reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is in an excellent location in this beautiful,laid back, relaxing Italian beach town. Our room was simple, clean and nice...no major frills! You will be able to walk to everything. The beach is a rocky tiny inlet...we had to purchase towels and mats once we arrived. Breakfast was great! Do not hesitate to book a room here...we had a great long weekend!!! We flew into Bari, rented a car was arrived withing 30 minutes. You will not find a ton of tourists--which we liked! The restaurant in the hotel was awesome...we had a fabulous meal and enjoyed walking to get coffee and pastries each day.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.text: Booked a classic room for 3, got the largest room but there was only 2 windows, so we upgraded to a suite including jacuzzi and grand veranda with relaxing bed etc. and a fantastic view of the town beach crevasse and rocky outcrops.
reviews.title: Great location - fabulous restaurant

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Covo dei Saraceni is a great hotel - but four stars leave a bit to be desired. Especially on the breakfast side. Don't know if a 2 star breakfast buffet is the norm in Italy, but it shouldn't be. Free Internet is a must with four stars - but apparantly not here.
reviews.title: good hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Hotel's restaurant however is fabulous. The food was delightful and the service great. Four stars to that!
reviews.title: Much room for improvement
